cooking_method:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
5. Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti, topped with grated Parmesan cheese.

1. Preheat the oven to 375Â°F.
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. Place the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs in separate shallow dishes.
4. Coat the chicken breasts in the flour, shaking off any excess. Dip the chicken in the eggs, then coat in breadcrumbs.
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
6. Pour the marinara sauce over the chicken and top with the shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

1. In a large bowl, toss the chopped romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
2. Top with croutons and grated Parmesan cheese.
